sentences.sentence: The 'border crisis' has left the border ᅳ the political response has been chaotic.Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicHundreds of thousands of migrants, many seeking asylum, have arrived in the United States over the last year, overwhelming already-strained resources in cities and states across the country.

Last week, in arguably one of the most immigration-friendly cities in the country, Mayor Eric Adams said that migrants would “destroy New York City.”This week on “Matter of Opinion,” the hosts discuss how the “border crisis” has come to frustrate Democratic politicians further north, and why the conversation about immigration is always actually about who we are as Americans.
(A transcript of this episode can be found in the center of the audio player above.

)Mentioned in this episode:·“Michael Bloomberg: How Biden and Congress Should Fix the Immigration Crisis in Our Cities,” by Michael R. Bloomberg in The New York Times·“Americans Still Value Immigration, but Have Concerns,” by Lydia Saad in Gallup“Michael Bloomberg: How Biden and Congress Should Fix the Immigration Crisis in Our Cities,” by Michael R. Bloomberg in The New York Times“Americans Still Value Immigration, but Have Concerns,” by Lydia Saad in GallupThoughts?

Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.com.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” is produced by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur.
It is edited by Stephanie Joyce.
Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker.
Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.
Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph by Mario Tama/Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: The ‘border crisis’ has left the border — the political response has been chaotic.Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicHundreds of thousands of migrants, many seeking asylum, have arrived in the United States over the last year, overwhelming already-strained resources in cities and states across the country. Last week, in arguably one of the most immigration-friendly cities in the country, Mayor Eric Adams said that migrants would “destroy New York City.”This week on “Matter of Opinion,” the hosts discuss how the “border crisis” has come to frustrate Democratic politicians further north, and why the conversation about immigration is always actually about who we are as Americans.(A transcript of this episode can be found in the center of the audio player above.)Mentioned in this episode:•“Michael Bloomberg: How Biden and Congress Should Fix the Immigration Crisis in Our Cities,” by Michael R. Bloomberg in The New York Times•“Americans Still Value Immigration, but Have Concerns,” by Lydia Saad in Gallup“Michael Bloomberg: How Biden and Congress Should Fix the Immigration Crisis in Our Cities,” by Michael R. Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.com.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” is produced by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur. It is edited by Stephanie Joyce. Mixing by Efim Shapiro. Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker. Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris. Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski. Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph by Mario Tama/Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
